intro: Hoarea × coccinea, commonly known as the red-flowered hoya, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Asclepiadaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red, depending on the variety. It is a popular houseplant due to its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its minimal care requirements. Hoarea × coccinea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
